gmd:metadataStandardName.gco:CharacterString: ISO 19139 Geographic Information - Metadata - Implementation Specification

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Broadband Wireless Coverage and Wireline Coverage: Indiana, 2013

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Arnon Tsairi, GIS Analyst, 39 Degrees North, LLC
Jim Sparks, Geographic Information Officer, Indiana Office of Technology

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: BROADBAND_COVERAGE_WIRELINE_WIRELESS_IN is a polygon feature class that contains broadband WIRELESS and WIRELINE coverage areas in Indiana, and was provided by personnel of the Indiana Office of Technology (IOT) and 39 Degrees North. The term WIRELESS includes the following techologies: Terrestrial Fixed Wireless - Unlicensed, Terrestrial Fixed Wireless - Licensed, and Terrestrial Mobile Wireless. The term WIRELINE includes the following techologies: AxDSL, DSL, Cable, and Fiber. The data set provided by IOT was in an ESRI geodatabase format and was named BROADBAND_INDIANAMAP_UPDATE_SPRING2013.GDB.

gmd:purpose.gco:CharacterString: This data set was developed to delineate broadband wireless (Terrestrial Fixed Wireless - Unlicensed, Terrestrial Fixed Wireless - Licensed, and Terrestrial Mobile Wireless) and wireline (AxDSL, DSL, Cable, and Fiber) coverages areas in Indiana.

gmd:credit.gco:CharacterString: Indiana Office of Technology (IOT), 39 Degrees North, compiled by Arnon Tsairi on 20110616 (data current as of 20131110).

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Indiana Office of Technology, Geographic Information Officer

gmd:deliveryPoint.gco:CharacterString: 100 North Senate Avenue, IGCN Rm N551

These data are intended for use only at the published scale or smaller and are for reference purposes only. They are not to be construed as a legal document or survey instrument. A detailed on-the-ground survey and historical analysis of a single site may differ from these data. gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: This file is available to anyone, but access may be contingent on written request, specific terms relevant to the agency or person making the request, and or) current freedom of information statutes in the state of Indiana.

gmd:environmentDescription.gco:CharacterString: ESRI ArcGIS version 10.2, Service Pack 2 (Build 3200) geodatabase format

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Based on metadata provided by IOT

gmd:supplementalInformation.gco:CharacterString: This dataset was created from multiple sources, primarily the Indiana Utility Regulatory Commission (IURC) and broadband service providers operating in Indiana.

gmd:measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: This data set was provided by IOT personnel and is assumed to be complete. The following is excerpted from the metadata provided by IOT: "Approximately 31,000 square miles of Indiana has wireline and wireless data from either the IURC or service providers in this data set."
This data set was provided by IOT personnel and is assumed to be accurate.
The following is excerpted from the metadata provided by IOT: "This data set was created from data provided by the IURC and service providers and joined to census blocks."

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: 39 Degrees North LLC received IURC data in shapefile format and service provider data in Excel format (which was joined to the census block layer). The IURC and service provider data were merged together to create a single dataset at the census block level. The boundaries in this dataset were dissolved to create a single polygon to deliniate the coverage area. All attribute fields were deleted and provided to IOT. Attribute fields will be included in future deliveries.

IGS personnel received an ESRI geodatabase named "BROADBAND_INDIANAMAP_UPDATE_SPRING2013.GDB" from personnel of 39 Degrees North LLC on May 23, 2013 (data are current as of May 14, 2013). The data was reprojected from WGS 1984 coordinate system to Universal Transverse Mercator (UTM), Zone 16, NAD83 using ESRI ArcCatalog. It was then exported to an ESRI shapefile format and renamed as BROADBAND_COVERAGE_WIRELINE_WIRELESS_IN.SHP to conform to internal naming conventions of the IGS.

IGS personnel received an ESRI geodatabase named "BROADBAND_FALL_UPDATE_2013.GDB" from personnel of 39 Degrees North LLC on November 13, 2013 (data are current as of October 22, 2013). The data was reprojected from WGS 1984 coordinate system to Universal Transverse Mercator (UTM), Zone 16, NAD83 using ESRI ArcCatalog. It was then exported to an ESRI shapefile format and renamed as BROADBAND_COVERAGE_WIRELINE_WIRELESS_IN.SHP to conform to internal naming conventions of the IGS.

This metadata file was pre-parsed and parsed using CNS (Chew and Spit, v. 2.6.1) and MP (Metadata Parser, v. 2.7.1) software written by Peter N. Schweitzer (U.S. Geological Survey). The errors generated by MP were all addressed and corrected, except that no values were assigned to "Abscissa_Resolution" and "Ordinate_Resolution."
Broadband wireless and wireline coverage areas in Indiana

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: IOT, Geographic Information Officer; Jim Sparks

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Based on metadata provided by IOT.

gmd:useLimitation.gco:CharacterString: This metadata file is intended to accompany the data set identified and received from the IGS. It should not to be altered or summarized. IGS does not support secondary distribution. If this data set was received from anyone besides the IGS, this metadata file and the data set it describes may lack integrity.
